fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can customize the customer portal request view, but it allows you to create a view where you have no way to navigate to the issue, for example: 

!Screen Shot 2021-11-18 at 2.15.57 pm.png|width=573,height=165!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the customer portal as the admin
 # Change the global columns setting and include only fields with no links, e.g. the dates. 
 # Navigate to the requests as a customer and you now will have a view where you cannot navigate to your requests. 

h3. Expected Results

There should be a way to navigate from the row to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

You cannot navigate to the issues
h3. Workaround

Revert the change and add a field, like Summary, which has a link to the request.
fields.summary: JSM customer portal customization shouldn't allow users to create a view with no links to issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some customers would like to be able to stop receiving CSAT survey for themselves.  Currently there is no way for an end user to opt-out of receiving these.  JSM is designed to automatically send these out when an issue gains a resolution value.  
The only option right now is for a project admin to enable or disable CSAT for the entire project.  There is no kind of exemption list of users that might not want to receiving such survey requests.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create a means for end users (users in the customer role) to be able to opt out of receiving CSAT survey emails.
* Ideally this would provide options on a per project and/or per site basis.

h3. Why this is important
* Some customers find CSAT requests an additional annoyance, but yet they have no means to stop requesting such emails reach them.
* There is no way for any user to opt out of receiving these when the project has them enabled

h3. Workaround 
no workaround is currently possible for this.
fields.summary: Allow customers to opt-out of receiving CSAT survey email notifications

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When Insight is used in a Datacenter and after decommissioning the dedicated node being used to execute Insight scheduling tasks, such as Importers, Automation, etc, the nodeid will be visible on the General Insight Configuration
{quote}Administration > Manage apps > Insight Configuration > Dedicated Scheduling Node
{quote}
This causes that scheduling tasks will not be triggered.
h3. Suggested Solution

We should find a way to clear out any old ids automatically or warn Jira administrators to change the Dedicated Scheduling Node for Insight
h3. Workaround

Edit the Insight Configuration and change the "Dedicated Scheduling Node"
 # Jira > Administration > Manage Apps > Insight Configuration and click on "Edit Settings"
 # Edit "Dedicated Scheduling Node",
 # Select one and Save.
fields.summary: Nodes ids should automatically be removed in Insight configuration Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Make it obvious that 'Object Schema Users permissions for JSM customers' need to be enabled for Insight CF on CP create request form to be usable to customers.

This is not really a bug because by enabling the 'Object Schema Users permissions for JSM customers' option, customers will no longer be blocked. However, due to the non-obviousness of this option to project admins/schema admins, they might miss it and leading to the following symptom. And that non-obviousness is a problem that should be addressed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight custom field and add it as a 'required' field to a JSM request type
 # Sign in as a user who is not an 'Object schema user' of the Insight object schema of which the custom field was related to
 # Try to create a request (of that specific request type) using the 'Create request' page on CP

h3. Expected Results

User should not be blocked from creating the request.
h3. Actual Results

User is blocked from creating the request due to them not having access to the object schema, thus unable to add a value to the 'required' custom field.

!cp-form-with-insight-custom-field.png|thumbnail!

!browse-insight-objects-dialog-without-any-selectable-item.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Enabling the 'Object Schema Users permissions for JSM customers' option as a schema admin would unblock the user.

!enabled-option.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested solution

As JSM project admins, when adding an Insight custom field to a request type form (without having the option already enabled), the system should prompt a warning message, informing them of the potential of a 'mis-configuration'. The project admin can either fix the config if it's a mis-configuration or acknowledge it's intended config by dismissing the warning.
fields.summary: Make it obvious that 'Object Schema Users permissions for JSM customers' need to be enabled for Insight CF on CP create request form to be usable to customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When SLA configuration changes all issues in the project may be re-indexed.
The re-index is done in a heavy way (real-time cross-cluster re-index) and can affect an unlimited number of issues.

This can cause the whole instance to fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with >50K issues on a multinode DC instance 
 # Change SLA configuration in the project

h3. Expected Results

SLAs on the project should be updated and no performance impact
h3. Actual Results

A huge number of indexing calls cause high CPU load and slow down the whole instance. Other indexing task may start to timeout (DBR - real time index replication,  NodeReindexService - delayed node index replication/index consistency check, ... any other re-indexing triggered by background, ie. non-http threads). This may cause index inconsistency between nodes which can eventually be only resolved with a full foreground reindex. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround for the problem.
fields.summary: SLA configuration changes create indexing pressure on the instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some Schema configuration, where objects have 2-3 references depth, and IQL Filter on Object Type Attributes (in each reference level), importing even a small number of objects may result in Referenced Attribute empty ....

Checking the Database - it seems like the target objects to be referenced have finished to create, AFTER the referencing Object was already fully updated, hence no objects were found to match the IQL filter on the Attribute...
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure 6 Object Types:
"Product" OT has references to the other 5 OTs with IQL on some Attributes:
        Team >>> Team OT (no IQL)
        Company >>> Company OT (IQL: Team=${Team} )
         Location >>> Location OT (IQL: Team=${Team} )
         Port >>> Port OT (IQL: Loacation = ${Location}
         Invoice >>> Invoice OT (IQL: Team = ${Team} AND Company = ${Company})
"Team" OT - no specific Attr.
"Company" OT has reference:
         Team >>> Team OT (no IQL filter)
"Location" OT:
          Team >>> Team OT (No IQL)
           Company >>> Company OT (simple IQL based on a Text Attribute, e.g. "Name  
           is not empty" ;) )
"Port" OT:
           Team >>> Team OT (No IQL)
           Location >>> Location OT (No IQL)
"Invoice" OT:
           Team >>> Team OT (No IQL)
           Company >>> Company OT (No IQL)
 
 # create some Objects in these OTs, and make sure that ALL Attributes are populated
 # Export the Object Schema and Import it to another Schema / Instance or, configure an Object Schema Import Type in another Schema / Instance, create predefined Structure and predefined configuration, enable all maps and synchronize

h3. Expected Results

All Objects are imported, all references are populated, exactly as in the source of the import
h3. Actual Results

All objects are created, but not all the Reference Attributes are populated - e.g:
the SOME Product Objects are missing their Port Attribute values....
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

If you can configure the Insight Object Schema Import Type on your Target (Empty) Schema/instance - create a Predefined Structure followed by a Predefined configuration.
Enable the Imports and all Object Type Maps.
Synchronize the Import more than once (2-3 times) then revise the results.
The first import may fail to populate all referenced attribute, but each import may populate more of the missing references, as the objects were already created.
fields.summary: Object Schema Export/Import, as well as the Object Schema Import type fail to popoulate references with objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Depending how a workflow is configured, there can be at least 2 different transitions leading to the same status:
- Transition 1: From status A to status C
- Transition 2: From status B to status C

Some customers might need to trigger the automation rule only upon transition 1, but not transition 2.

This specific scenario is not possible out-of-the-box using the Jira Service Management Automation feature. It is not possible since, when using the WHEN trigger as "status changed" and the IF condition as "issue matches: status = status C", the automation rule will be executed upon both transition 1 and transition 2.

h3. Suggestion

Add a new WHEN trigger or IF condition, so that the automation rule will be triggered/executed only when an issue is transitioned from status A to status C (but not from status B to status C)
fields.summary: Add the ability to trigger an automation on a specific transition (from Status A to Status B)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copy pasting from locally installed MS word / MS excel / Outlook, from bullet points, with periods in them, part of the content is stripped by Jira's visual editor. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a bullet list in MS word with periods in it.  
 # Copy and paste into Jira's visual comment editor
 # Notice how parts of the content have been stripped.

See screenshot below, notice how parts of the IP address copied into Jira have been stripped

!mswordbulletpt.png|width=415,height=360!
h3. Expected Results
 * All content is copy pasted correctly

h3. Actual Results

Part of the content is stripped 
h3. Workaround

Copy pasting in text mode does not cause issues with content being stripped, but loses some of the formatting.
fields.summary: Copy pasting bullet lists with fullstops from MS Office in JSM visual comment section strips content

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an Insight custom field has a value that contains the "&" character it displays incorrectly when editing the issue, revealing its ampersand value. This is not seen on other screens.

We observed this in the following scenarios:
* When selecting on the Create screen, the & symbol shows up correctly, as per the screenshot below: 
!image-2021-11-10-11-28-13-646.png|thumbnail! 
* When viewing on the VIEW screen, the & symbol also shows up correctly:
 !image-2021-11-10-11-28-49-921.png|thumbnail! 
* When editing on the EDIT screen, the & symbol shows as follows:
 !image-2021-11-10-11-29-33-864.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object that has the & character.
# Add an Insight custom field to an edit issue screen, filling it with the object created on step #1.
 # Create an issue and fill the custom field added into step #2.
# Attempt to edit the issue and note the bug happening.

h3. Expected Results
The character would show just its human-readable value ({{&}}), as it does on any other operation such as on Create issue screen.

h3. Actual Results
The character shows its respective ampersand value, as follows:
{noformat}
 &. 
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here if available
fields.summary: "&" character in Insight custom fields displays incorrectly on edit issue screen

fields.description:
Most recently added Request Type should be searched and presented at the TOP in the Search Result for Customer to select the correct Request Type

*Reproducible Steps*
1.Create project#1 with 2 Request Type having, let says "cloud" keyword in description of both of the Request Type
2.Create project#2 with 2 Request Type with "cloud" keyword in description of both of the Request Type
3.Create project#3 with 2 Request Type with name "{*}cloud - RT1{*}" and "{*}cloud - RT2{*}"
4.Now if you search with keyword "cloud", customer expects to see the RT from project#3 i.e latest ones created having cloud keyword in name or description.

*Expected Result*

The newly created Request type having the matching keyword (either in Name or Description) should be listed at the top

*Actual Result*
At present, the Request type from Project#1 & Project#2 are listed as shown below and NOT from the newest Request Type created in Project#3

!image-2021-11-10-16-38-41-896.png|width=122,height=86!
fields.summary: Newly added Request Types should be listed at the top while making search in customer Portal(general Search)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever a user tries to create an issue through the [HTML links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-create-issues-using-direct-html-links-in-jira-server-159474.html] where there's an Insight custom field included in the URL syntax this custom field never gets populated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field. e.g.: CF_Broken_Car
 # Note the custom field ID: 10400.
 # Note the object name (or its ID): Mercedes (or 138).
 # Create an issue using the HTML link: http://<jira-home>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10100&issuetype=10200&summary=test+summary&reporter=admin&priority=3&customfield_10400=138

h3. Expected Results

To see the needed object populated in the custom field:

!image-2021-11-10-11-24-23-722.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The custom field never gets populated with any value but instead its drop down menu completely disappears:

!image-2021-11-10-11-24-53-149.png|thumbnail!

 

(i) THIS IS LIMITED TO THE INSIGHT CUSTOM FIELD AS I'VE TRIED IT WITH A STANDARD CUSTOM FIELD (CAN BE SEEN IN THE SCREENSHOTS AS {_}CF_Select_Options{_}) AND IT WORKED JUST FINE.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround *but* the user can exclude the insight object from the URL and add it manually in the issue creation page.
fields.summary: Creating a Jira issue using HTML link fails to populate the insight custom field with the chosen object.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Linux systems, maintaining Jira Home directory on a separate disk from Jira Install directory results in corruption and inconsistencies in Insight Asset Management

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira on one drive, and specify Jira Home directory on a different drive. Each drive should be a separate physical device with its own mount point (not the same device split into multiple volumes).
 # Create an Object Schema in Insight
 # Restart Jira or re-index Insight

h3. Expected Results
Insight re-indexes as normal, and the object schema looks fine

h3. Actual Results
 * The following is observed in the Jira application logs
{code:java}
Unable to read objects from file /data/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objectschema
Unable to read objects from file /data/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objecttype
{code}
 * An OS-level warning occurs such as:
{code:java}
[pid 11171] rename("/app/username/atlassian/jira/temp/temporary_7457170785938412024.part", "/common/username/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/insight_indexes/objects") = -1 EXDEV (Invalid cross-device link)
{code}
* Insight's index becomes corrupted. Searches display inconsistent results or no results at all.

h3. Workaround

Maintain the Jira Home directory on the same device/volume as the Jira Install directory. With this setup, indexing Insight works as expected.
fields.summary: Insight fails to re-index when Jira Home directory is on a separate physical device from Jira Install directory

h3. Issue Summary

Viewing a request shared with a customer organization with thousands (10k+) of users doesn't scale.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create an organization

 # Share a request on the customer portal with this organization

No performance impact from users viewing request

As more users view the request, excessive calls to DB are made which impacts the performance of the instance

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight report cannot be shared to group due to the naming convention in use

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create more than 5 Jira groups such as following example:
 !Screenshot 2021-11-08 at 14.30.05.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-11-08 at 14.33.35.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an Insight filter and try to share it with group ta-administrators. Observe that it cannot be found, not even when typing it completely and so the Add button not available:
 !Screenshot 2021-11-08 at 14.29.27.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
group should be found and added
h3. Actual Results
group cannot be found if there are other 5 groups before in alphabetical order which contains the name of it (ex. meta-administrators)

h3. Workaround
Workaround for now would be only to avoid using this kind of naming convention for group or create a dedicated one in order to share the report with those users.
fields.summary: Insight report cannot be shared to group due to the naming convention in use

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The explanation for Threshold Type and Threshold Number can be found at [Create object type mapping|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/2-create-object-type-and-attribute-mapping-1044784497.html#id-2.Createobjecttypeandattributemapping-Createobjecttypemapping] by clicking on "View fields for object type mapping".

The explanation is as follows
{quote}
Threshold Type	
When objects are missing in the data source, you can specify a threshold for the Update and Delete configurations. This means that Insight will wait with performing these actions until the conditions specified in the threshold are met (days, synchronizations)

Threshold Number	
The number of days/synchronizations before performing the actions described above.
{quote}

h3. Suggestion
An example of how to use these fields would be great. For example
{quote}
When you have the 'Threshold Type' set to Synchronizations and 'Threshold Number' set to 1, this means missing objects will only be removed starting from the second synchronization. Similarly, if you set the 'Threshold Number' set to 2, the missing objects will be removed on the third synchronization onwards.

If you wish to remove missing objects on the first synchronization onwards, set the 'Threshold Number' to 0.
{quote}
fields.summary: Additional explanation of Threshold Type and Threshold Number fields in the documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding an attachment in customer portal adds the attachment, but persists the uploading animation and locks out other functionality
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the customer portal
 # Create a new request
 # Add an attachment

Also reproducible when:
 # you add an attachment with no comment string
 # doesn't have any existing comments

h3. Expected Results

Should add attachment and continue using customer portal
h3. Actual Results
 * Attachment gets stuck with spinner
 * error thrown to console
 * adding more attachments does nothing
 * trying to remove the attachment does nothing

h3. Workaround
 * add a comment with the attachment before saving
 * sometimes it is okay when theres already an existing comment with the request
fields.summary: Adding an attachment to an issue in customer portal gets stuck

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue statement

In Jira Service Management (JSM) projects, Customer Notifications are sent every minute. If multiple updates to a ticket (comments, status change...) happen within the same minute, JSM will combine all these events into 1 single notification.

The problem is that:
- the events are listed in the request in the customer portal view in reverse chronological order:
 !CurrentBehavior_CustomerPortalView.png|thumbnail! 
- the events are listed in the customer notification in chronological order:
 !CurrentBehavior_Customer_Notification.png|thumbnail! 

Because of that, the order of events in the customer notification compared to the portal is the opposite

h3. Suggestion

Add a setting to the JSM project so that the events listed in the customer notification can be reversed.
fields.summary: Add the ability to reverse the order of the events included in the Customer Notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently we have issues with some customers not uploading attachments properly through the customer portal. The two-step (Upload and then Add) process for attachments leads to attachments not being applied. The customer thinks that they have completed the attachment after the Upload step (not realizing that they have to select the Add button). The attachment should apply immediately on the ticket or the interface should be more explicit to let the customer know they have not completed the process.
fields.summary: Update Customer Portal Attachment Upload Process

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As an agent, I would like to be able to filter issues where there are customer comments. This currently is hindered because attachments are added as comments in the customer portal, so when you filter by comments, these attachment uploads also display. I would like to be able to only see the comments that are not attachment reated.
fields.summary: Provide ability with JQL to filter customer comments that are not attachments

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hey Team,

Insight LDAP import should have a feature to import all the groups information on the user objects when there are nested groups present as part of LDAP server.

The feature should be capable of handling N-level nested groups. It means, if the user is part of a group which is nested and level-20, or level-30 user object should display all the groups information of which the user and group belongs to.

*UseCase*:
 - We have user XYZ and he directly belongs to GROUP-A.
 - Group-A is part of a bigger Group-B and Group-B might even belong to Group-C and list goes on upto the required level (there can be a limit applied to avoid performance issues).
 - requirement is to list all of those groups to display under one single attribute on the USER object.
fields.summary: Insight LDAP import configuration should have the feature to import nested groups as part of the user objects (N-level nesting)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Selecting 'Unlinked issues' filter in JSM queue page hides issues not linked with major incidents
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure 'Opsgenie interation' as Jira admin
 # In JSM project setting, enable 'Incident management' for this project
 # Go to queue page of the JSM project
 # Choose 'Unlinked issues' filter in the top-right corner filter dropdown

h3. Expected Results

Only issues linked with major incidents should be hidden after the 'Unlinked issues' filter is applied.
h3. Actual Results

Many issues which are not linked with any major incidents are hidden. Refer to the screen recording [^unlinked-issues-filter-broken.mov].
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Selecting 'Unlinked issues' filter in JSM queue page hides issues not linked with major incidents

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using keyboard to navigate/focus to 'Unlinked issues' filter in a JSM queue of a incident-management-enabled project renders the text with very low contrast.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure 'Opsgenie interation' as Jira admin
 # In JSM project setting, enable 'Incident management' for this project
 # Go to queue page of the JSM project
 # Choose 'Unlinked issues' filter in the top-right corner filter dropdown
 # Use keyboard to tab-navigate to the dropdown, & use down arrow key to move focus onto the 'Unlinked issues' filter item

h3. Expected Results

The 'Unlinked issues' text should still appear in a white-ish color with high enough contract.
h3. Actual Results

The 'Unlinked issues' text is rendered with a dark color with very low contract against the background color.

[^low-contrast-unlinked-issues.mov]
h3. Workaround

Use mouse to click open the dropdown & hover/click on the 'Unlinked issues' filter instead.
fields.summary: Using keyboard to navigate/focus to 'Unlinked issues' filter in a JSM queue of a incident-management-enabled project renders the text with very low contrast

h3. Issue Summary
(i) The steps below only appear to display the issue if you view an Insight object (with a text field box) from searching *Insight* menu > *Search for objects*. If you look at the same object from the object schema, this issue does not appear.

When entering a text in a text field box on an Insight object, the text field box will ignore the letter 't' if you type the letter 'p' before it. For example; if you type "laptop" you will only see "lapop"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project in Jira with sample data and use the "Insight IT Service Management" option
# Go to *Insight* menu > *Search for objects*
# Make sure the schema selected is the one created from the sample project created. In the IQL enter in "{{objectType = Employees}}"
# Open "Anton Dry" in a new browser tab
# Click *Edit* on the page with Anton's details
# In the field called "Role Description" enter in the following:
{{Laptop adoption expert}}
Note that the text actually says "Lapop adopion expert".

h3. Expected Results
The field should have the phrase "Laptop adoption expert" in it.

h3. Actual Results
The field actually has "Lapop adopion expert" in it instead. It is missing the letter "t" if it follows a "p"

h3. Workaround
There doesn't appear to be logs on this issue, nor is there a workaround that I could find.

Have tested in Insight 8.9.3 and 9.1.2

fields.description:
Researchers at the University of Cambridge reported a vulnerability affecting Jira Service Management Server / DC (and Insight Asset Management app) where special characters, known as Unicode bidirectional override characters, are not rendered or displayed in the affected applications. These special characters are typically not displayed by the browser or code editors but can affect the meaning of the source code when it is processed by a compiler or an interpreter. The issue is now fixed.

*Affected versions:*
 * *Jira Service Management Server and Data Center*
 ** All versions before 4.13.13
 ** All versions between 4.14.0 and 4.19.1 (inclusive)
 ** All 4.20.x LTS versions before 4.20.1

 * *Insight Asset Management* (Marketplace app for Jira Service Management)
 ** All versions before 8.9.4

*Fixed versions:*
 * *Jira Service Management Server and Data Center*
 ** 4.13.13
 ** 4.20.1
 * *Insight Asset Management* (Marketplace app for Jira Service Management)
 ** 8.9.4
fields.summary: Unicode characters allow malicious code to be hidden from a human reviewer (JSM Server & Insight asset management App) - CVE-2021-42574

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Scanning a Linux Machine using the "Linux_Hostinfo_SystemUpTime.pat" will calculate the wrong System Uptime due to the removal of a decimal point.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup the Insight Discovery Tool to scan a Linux machine.
 # Provide SSH Credentials, and make sure that the Pattern "Linux_Hostinfo_SystemUpTime.pat" is enabled.
 # Set logging level to DEBUG in order to review the Pattern responses.
 # Scan your Linux machine, revise the Scan Log note the results for the "Linux_Hostinfo_SystemUpTime.pat" pattern execution
 # Import the results into Insight
 # Revise the scan results XML and the Imported values for System Uptime & System Uptime Minutes

h3. Expected Results

The Scan Pattern Results are imported and displayed as expected in the XML file as well as in Insight Host Object
h3. Actual Results

The XML shows the WRONG number of minutes - discarding the decimal point by actually extending the Uptime Minutes, which is then used to calculate Uptime giving the wrong result (much higher than actual)
 The Scan Log shows the correct result:
{noformat}
10/19/2021 19:05:57 : Using pattern: Linux_Hostinfo_SystemUpTime.pat (v3.1.1)
10/19/2021 19:05:57 : Command: 
    uptime | sed -E 's/^[^,]*up *//; s/, *[[:digit:]]* users.*//; s/min/minutes/; s/([[:digit:]]+):0?([[:digit:]]+)/\1 hours, \2 minutes/'
    
10/19/2021 19:05:57 : Result: 23 hours, 49 minutes,  1 user,  load average: 15.07, 15.03, 15.00

10/19/2021 19:05:57 : Command: cat /proc/uptime
10/19/2021 19:05:57 : Result: 85751.06 1449085.51

10/19/2021 19:05:57 : pattern executed in 0.2235765 seconds{noformat}
The scan results XML and Insight are showing the wrong results:
 !image (1).png|thumbnail!
 The actual System Up Time Minutes should be *1429.18m* (= 85751.06sec = 23h 49m 10s - correct) and not 142918m (=99d 5h 58m - INCORRECT!)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scanning a Linux Server in Insight Discovery miscalculates the uptime when parsing the response information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When sending datetime or timestamp values via Http request in [Insight automation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/configuring-automation-rules-1044784502.html], they are sent using Jira system time and Jira time format. This is not consistent with data returned from the REST API, which uses ISO8601 format with all times in UTC.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the data consistent whether it is pulled via REST API or pushed via httprequest. 

h3. Why this is important

This creates significant challenges for external integrations. If data is pushed to an external integration via httprequest, but later the integration is modified so that it pulls data from Insight instead, the data returned will be a different format and may fail to be parsed.
fields.summary: Insight datetime and timestamp data is not consistent between REST API and HttpRequest automation

fields.description:
Adding the option to force an attribute to store a certain case of letters (uppercase or lowercase) while importing will be very helpful with a scenario where the customer needs only a certain one in an attribute (e-mail address for example). So, whatever the value stored in the file being imported it will be automatically converted into the default value defined (either upper or lower case).

======

Case scenario:
A customer is importing from two different sources where the e-mail address is saved in uppercase in one source and in lowercase in the other. So, the attribute kept updated on every import (once to uppercase then to lowercase). Hence, the customer wanted to set the attribute value to be stored only in lowercase so these imports won't make any change to the database anymore (as they will always be stored in lowercase anyway).
fields.summary: Adding the option to force upper/lower case attributes.

h3. Issue Summary

Insight import UI displays wrong weekdays when using Cron Expression.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object Schema
 # Create any Insight Import Configuration (CSV, Discovery or any other)
 # Tick "Automatically synchronize" and set the following Cron Expression \\
{quote}0 27 12 ? * 3
{quote}\\
 !image-2021-10-26-15-08-13-890.png|width=548,height=227!
 # Insight UI translates to 'At 12:27 PM, only on *Wednesday*'
 !image-2021-10-26-15-10-19-089.png|width=590,height=182!
 # Cron is triggered on Tuesday instead of on Wednesday

h3. Expected Results

Insight UI should display '*At 12:27 PM, only on Tuesday*'. 
 Wednesday field is 4 and Tuesday is 3

Ref: [http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.3.0/tutorials/crontrigger.html]
h3. Actual Results

Insight Displays the wrong day (*Wednesday*) when the import will be triggered.
h3. Workaround

Instead of using Day-of-week field, to avoid confusion, use for example, “MON,WED,FRI” in the day-of-week field. For this scenario would be:

{quote}0 27 12 ? * TUE {quote}

fields.description:
Problem:
Users would like to be able to apply context filter to the Request Participants field to make the users displayed more relevant to the context being displayed.

Solution:
Unlock the field and apply contexts to allow filtering of user results : https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlock-a-locked-jira-software-custom-field-779158866.html

Why important:
Prevents the accidental sharing of information to a wrong user with the same name due the way in which users are displayed in User Pickers
Will speed up if implemented correctly the API request for the users
Enhances confidence and informational security of the system.

Workaround:
Unlock field via https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unlock-a-locked-jira-software-custom-field-779158866.html, apply context changes.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is no option to migrate all data from Insight - Asset Management from Cloud to Jira Service Management DC (On-Prem)

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Support the export/import of Insight for Jira data
 * Ability to migrate Insight for Jira data using full Jira XML export/Import

h3. Why this is important
* Customers who cannot stay on Cloud, need to be able to "easily" migrate from Cloud to DC.
 * When we perform the migration from Cloud to Server, we are hoping to minimize the data loss after the migration.

h3. Workaround
The only option is to export each Object Type as a CSV, then import these - one by one into corresponding Object Types. 
You will have to manually create the Object Types in the target instance, and import Object Types in the required order.
fields.summary: Insight migration path from Cloud to DC

 # Create some priorities in Jira like 1, 2, add them to the project
 # Create an SLA by selecting this priority in the JQL 
# Try creating an issue where the JQL above is satisfied

h3. Expected Results
SLA will show up in the issue

h3. Actual Results
SLA will not show up in the issue


h3. Workaround
* Either use priority names without numeric values
* Or, use the Priority ID in the JQL as in the screenshot
fields.summary: SLAs will not work properly with custom priorities if the name has numeric values

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The field configuration works in a way that if it's added to the request type screen, it's shown and if the field is removed, the field is removed from all the issues which are using that screen. Jira currently does not have an "in-between" feature where if a request has values for the field which was removed, it'll be continued to be displayed. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a field "ABC" on the customer request Type screen to appear on customer-portal
 #  Create some issues(issue 1, issue 2), with some values in the field ABC
 # Remove the field "ABC" from the customer request Type screen.
 # ABC field and the values will be removed from issue 1 and issue 2 also.
 # We should have the option to keep the values of removed fields for the existing issues that have some values entered already.

h3. Expected Results

issue 1 and issue 2 should be displaying the field ABC and its value even after removing the field from the screen.
h3. Actual Results

If we remove the field from the screen, it is removed for all issues in the project.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Removing a field from customer-portal request-form remove the data from existing issues

In the agent facing view (Jira view) of Jira Service Management tickets, internal comments are labelled with "Internal", but public comments don't have any label:
 !Current_Behavior.png|thumbnail! 

The problem is that, without any label added to external comments, it is hard to tell if the comment is public or not.

h3. Suggestions

Add an "external" label to external comments, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !Desired_Behavior.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add an external label to public comments on the agent facing view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
we have currently the challenge that our efforts to follow GDPR regulations cannot be met with standard the Jira functionalities when using the Insight add-on.

*Current Situation*
1. Users are created as objects in Insight (First & Last Name, Email, Manager etc)
2. Jira issues are populated with these objects
3. When a user leaves the company, user data is removed from LDAP. Insight object related to user is deleted
4. User is anonymized in the Jira
5. Information regarding insight object is no longer present in the issue, but it is still present in the *issue history*, even though the user no longer exists in Insight, and it is anonymized in Jira user management.

h3. Expected result:
Allow Insight user data (viz., attributes etc.) to be anonymized along with JSM (Jira) anonymizer
fields.summary: Allow GDPR Compliance for Insight data by Anonymizing user data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ever since Insight 8.6.11 / 8.6.15, the LDAP and DB imports are only configurable for Schema Managers who are ALSO Jira Admins.
 The Permission Check seems to be triggered even on other Import Types, and generates a Permission Error, while the Import configuration can still be saved.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a New Object Schema and assign User X as the Schema manager. User X is NOT a Jira / Insight Admin.
 # Log in as User X, navigate to the Schema Configuration>Import
 # Configure a new CSV Import
 # After Uploading a CSV file, click Test Connection or Next.

h3. Expected Results

CSV Connection will be tested and / or the wizard will advance to the next screen
h3. Actual Results

An Error Banner is showing, BUT - the connection is tested and or the wizard does advance to the next screen
 Sorry, you do not have permission to perform this action.. PermissionInsightException: User JIRAUSER10300 didn't have correct permission (manager).
  
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No need for a workaround, as the functionality is maintained.

Basic search for an attribute for example name within one of the child objects will return results from BOTH child objectTypes even if you only want to search within one of the child objectTypes. This is affecting all Insight versions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a parent objectType and activate inheritance
 # Create two child objectTypes
 # Have one of the child objectTypes have 3 objects named 1,2 and 3 and the other child objectType have 4 and 5 as names
 # 5 perform a basic search selecting child objectType 1. You will see results from both child objectTypes which would be 1,2,3,4 5

!image-2021-10-19-22-45-45-998.png|width=495,height=312!
h3. Expected Results

The results should only show names from the selected child objecType
h3. Actual Results

Shows results from all the child objectTypes
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Deactivate inheritance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring an A4J Action to Create / Edit an Issue which involves an Insight CF - any Object can be set into the Insight CF! disregarding the CF configuration (Schema Assignment and IQL filters)

A4J v. 7.3.5
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Having Jira Admin Global permission - configure an Automation Rule (Project or Global Automation) with an action to create/ edit an Issue which has an Insight CF in it
 # Add the Insight CF and type any search string for the Field Value search
Note that Objects may be listed from different Schemas.
 # Select ANY object (make sure it is not from the schema configured in the Insight Field Configuration)
 # Publish the rule and trigger it

h3. Expected Results

The non valid object cannot be selected to populate the CF in the Rule configuration.
If the Object IS selecteable, it should not be able to populate the Insight CF.
h3. Actual Results

The Insight CF is populated with an Object which does not correspond to the Insight CF Configuration...
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Make sure to select the correct Object when configuring the rule.
In order to avoid undesired Object to populate - you may use the JSON Payload in the Automation Rule, to populate the Insight CF with a specific Object Key (details [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/insightapps/insight-with-jira-rest-api-1085180905.html])
fields.summary: Automation for Jira when using an Insight CF disregards the Insight IQL configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation runs when a user rejects a request by adding a comment, if the automation is set to trigger on Primary action. The Rejection should be treated as Primary action and the Automation shouldn’t be triggering but currently that doesn’t seem to be the case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Automation to trigger if 'Comment is Primary action' and to Re-open the ticket
# Have an Approval stage in the workflow and let the user add a Comment while rejecting the request.

h3. Expected Results
Rejection should be considered as the Primary action and the Automation shouldn’t run.

h3. Actual Results
Automation runs and the ticket gets reopened.


h3. Workaround
Add an *IF* condition to the Automation to trigger according to the *Status*
fields.summary: Automation runs when a user rejects a request by adding a comment

{

        "cloudwatch:Describe*",
        "dynamodb:List*",
        "dynamodb:Describe*",
        "ec2:Describe*",
        "ecr:List*",
        "ecr:Describe*",

h3. Issue Summary

Looping CAPTCHA on public signup via customer portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup public signup for JSM following [Enabling public signup and CAPTCHA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/enabling-public-signup-and-captcha-1027137700.html] to the letter.
 !image-2021-10-15-12-02-46-011.png|thumbnail!

 # Go to http://<jira_base_url>/servicedesk/customer/user/signup and signup
!image-2021-10-15-12-04-13-436.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Customers should be able to sign up successfully with the correct CAPTCHA entered.
h3. Actual Results

Customers receive repeated CAPTCHA loop prompts on sign up. No error was observed in the logs. HTTP status code 400 received in the HAR file.

{code}

 # Go to *Configuration* under *JIRA SERVICE MANAGEMENT* section
 # Choose *No, customers can just sign up* under *Public signup* section
fields.summary: Looping CAPTCHA on public signup via customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While attempting to import an Insight Schema, if one object fails, it does not continue for next rows on the same Object Type csv file leading to an incomplete import on target.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * +On the Source instance+
 ** Create 2 Object Types with references. Use the below example:
 !Object Type 1.png|width=874,height=206! 
 !Object Type 2.png|width=874,height=206!
 ** Create some dummy objects on both Object Types
 ** On Object Type "_+A++D User 1+_", attribute "_+UserId+_" set Cardinality value to minimum 1
 ** Create a few "+_AD User 1_+" objects. They will have the '+_UserId_+' attribute required.
 !Objects Ad User.png|width=874,height=206!
 !AD Group.png|width=874,height=206!
 ** Export the Schema
 *** Insight > Configure > Object Schema Export
 !image-2021-10-14-17-39-55-856.png|width=342,height=164!

 * +On the target instance+
 ** Import the Schema. (i) Only 2 out of 5 were imported
 *** Insight > Configure > Object Schema Import

h3. Expected Results

If one object fails, it should be skipped and the import continues on the next row. In this case, +_user3_+ should have been imported as it got all required attributes values.
h3. Actual Results
 * None of the "AD User 1" objects were imported
 !Import_result.png|width=316,height=164! 
 !Target Import.png|width=802,height=127!

The following appears in the insight_objectschema_import. log.
{noformat}
2021-10-14 15:14:08,918 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | Unable to import objects for object type AD User 1 with id 19 due to null value encountered on line 2 on column 6
2021-10-14 15:14:08,918 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | Invalid reference found, object key from export: ITSM-19
2021-10-14 15:14:08,918 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | Finished object key lookup for objectId: 24, reference objects length: 1
2021-10-14 15:14:08,918 [insight-InsightThreadGroup-worker-thread-1] | No valid references for attribute type 107
{noformat}
 * Search for the "_AD User1_" in the Schema.xml (included in the Schema Export) - to get the Object Type ID - (15)
 * In the Schema export directory, open the _file 15.csv_.
 ** As the first row is invalid (_UserID_ is required but it has no value), next rows will not be imported either.
 !CSV.png|width=361,height=85!
 * 

h3. Workaround

In the source instance, ensure that every object has a value for those required attributes.

KB was published to find invalid data: [Unable to import objects for object type X with id X due to null value encountered - Insight Schema import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+import+objects+for+object+type+X+with+id+X+due+to+null+value+encountered+-+Insight+Schema+import]
fields.summary: Incomplete Insight Schema Import

fields.description:
The customer portal issue view should automatically refresh when changes are made to an issue.

Currently, when an agent makes changes to an issue in the Jira, those changes are not reflecting/updated on the portal issue view automatically. The customer has to manually refresh the portal (through the browser refresh option) from time to time to view the updates.

This feature request is to build the functionality in the portal to refresh automatically when any changes are made to the issue through the Jira application by agents.

As a workaround, these browser extensions for [Chrome|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tab-auto-refresh/jaioibhbkffompljnnipmpkeafhpicpd?hl=en] and [Firefox|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/tab-auto-refresh/] can help to enable auto-refresh for a particular browser tab.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue in sending notification for _+*Single User*+_ while using _+*Respond to Customer*+_ option.

((on) This is after editing the Notification scheme to have the option as below)

!image-2021-10-12-17-26-23-915.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - setup a new out-of-the-box service desk project.
 - setup a notification for "Issue commented" to be sent to a _+*Single User*+_ (add any test user here)
 - create an issue
 - comment (inline) and use the "Share with customer" option
 - *Result*:
 (i) You can notice that A notification is sent to the Single User added earlier.

 - *(x) However*, If Use the "*Respond to customer*" button to open the dialog box and
 - Add a comment in the comment field and click the button "Respond to customer" option
 - (!) The comment is added, but no notification is sent to the "Single User"

h3. Expected Results

Comments that are added via the "Respond to customer" dialog must trigger the commented issue event
h3. Actual Results

Comments are added but no notifications are sent
h3. Workaround

(on) Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior and it is required to use the "*Share with customer*" option to trigger the notification for *"Single User"*
fields.summary: Issue in sending notification for Single User while using Respond to Customer option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary While viewing KB articles from within a customer portal, Safari might enter a loop when calculating and resizing a responsive macro such as tables, columns, multimedia, etc, causing the elements to "wiggle" or "shake", making the content difficult to read. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Link a Jira Service Management project to a Confluence space, by following the steps in the KB article [Guide to link Knowledge Base to Jira Service Management for unlicensed usern|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/guide-to-link-knowledge-base-to-jira-service-desk-for-unlicensed-user-816677228.html]. # In Confluence, install the app [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?hosting=server]. # Create a new blank page named *Test KB* in the Confluence space linked to the JSM project, then publish it. # Edit the newly created page, then click the *Open in source editor* button: !confluence-source-editor.png|thumbnail! # Enter the following text in the source editor, then click *Apply* and publish the page again. {noformat:none|title=}


Access to Suggested Group Name Description
Site 1 Administrators
  • Description 1 
  • Make this the top level group and nest all other access groups underneath this for easier management
Site 2 Site administrators
  • Description 1 
  • Description 2 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
Site 3 Page Administrators
  • Description 1 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
  • Description 2 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
Space 1 Site test
  • Description 1 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
  • Description 2 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
  • Description 1 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
  • Description 2 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
Space 2 Custom page
  • Description 1 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page
  • Description 2 long enough to wrap at least one new line in the page


{noformat} # In Jira, navigate to the customer portal using the customer link (i.e. {{/servicedesk/customer/portal/1}}), then enter *Test KB* in the search box, and click on the search result to open the KB. h3. Expected Results The KB article is rendered normally, and no page elements "shake" or "wiggle" around. h3. Actual Results Safari enters a loop recalculating the position of the elements, causing them to "shake", and making the page very difficult to read. Here's a short video showing a side-by-side comparison of Chrome (left) and Safari (right): * [^chrome-safari.mov] And here's profiling data collected from Chrome and Safari: * [^chrome-profiling.json] * [^safari-profiling.json] (i) It's interesting to note the issue only seems to occur when the KB article is viewed through the JSM customer portal; the issue does not seem to occur when viewing the same page in Confluence. h3. Workaround * Use a browser other than Safari, as it seems like this is the only affected browser, or; * In Confluence, edit the tables to change them from *Responsive* to *Fixed Width,* or; * The issue does not seem to occur in Jira Service Management 8.19.1, so upgrading to this version or above might also be an option.
fields.summary: Tables may be rendered incorrectly when viewing KB articles in Safari
